para.sentence: An Abelian function is a 2g -fold periodic, meromorphic function of g complex variables.
In consequence, Abelian functions are generalizations of elliptic functions (§23.2(iii)) to more than one complex variable.

For every Abelian function, there is a positive integer n , such that the Abelian function can be expressed as a ratio of linear combinations of products with n factors of Riemann theta functions with characteristics that share a common period lattice.
For further information seeIgusa (1972, pp. 132–135) and Markushevich (1992).
